content: of autumn the entire project culminates in a final geometric piece before all sections are united and crowned with a decorative final border completing this yearlong masterpiece your entire vivaldi project will be knitted using oasis camel silk dk a truly luxurious and irresistible yarn this exotic sultry blend of 50% camel fiber and 50% mulberry silk provides unmatched softness and a silken glow * click here 9 to watch a video about this month s clue * the blanket used approximately 1 258 yds 1 150 m total c1 183 yds 167 m c2 188 yds 172 m c3 211 yds 193 m c4 98 yds 90 m c5 43 yds 39 m c6 85 yds 78 m c7 48 yds 44 m c8 95 yds 87 m c9 48 yds 44 m c10 83 yds 76 m c11 23 yds 21 m and c12 153 yds 140 m these yardages only include the amounts used in the clues themselves extra yardage used as colorwork will be specified in the respective clue notes * **very important you will need to keep the leftover partial skeins as you will need some of them later in the pattern ** * this blanket is inspired by the different stages of a day and the four seasons you will begin this project by initially working in the round by strategically placing increases the round shape is transformed into a square you will continue to work in the round until the desired diameter is reached then you will work along the four edges of the square each one representing one of the four seasons of a year uniform decreases on both sides of each quadrant will create a triangle which will become your new square tip an ornamental border is added by picking up stitches around the square * all slipped stitches are slipped purlwise if not otherwise noted * lifelines are a very helpful tool in this project please take advantage of them in the lace portions of the design * beads are optional for clue 2 but are required for clue 3 * clues 4 and 8 and 6 and 10 are interchangeable if the instructions of one of the clues are too challenging you can substitute it with another one at any time * the same is true for clues 5 and 9 and 7 and 11 substitute one of them with another one at any time * please make sure to carefully read every clue s specific note before starting each clue * because i am a rather tight knitter i highly recommend checking your gauge against mine to ensure that you have enough yarn to complete the design and reach the desired measurements gauge is crucial to this project since some clues use almost all of the yardage given in a skein please make sure to be on gauge to not run out of yarn * each clue s notes include unblocked and blocked clue
